revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=DGND3800B |revision=-100GRS |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=03/16/2011 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Foxconn |manuf_model=U12L144T11 |manuf_rev= |availability=common |type=wireless router,dsl modem |fcc_id=PY310100129 |ic_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM6368 |cpu1_cspeed=400 |cpu1_cores=2 |fla1=32 |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla2=128 |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=Samsung |ram1_model=K4H511638J-LCCC |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=Mini PCI,USB 2.0 |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num=1 |expansion_usb_num=2 |jtag= |serial=yes,, (115200,8,N,1) |wi1_module=Foxconn 95.0343T01 |wi1_module_if=Mini PCI |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM43222 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module=Foxconn 95.0343T01 |wi2_module_if=Mini PCI |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM43222 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model=BCM53115 |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags=VDSL,ADSL2+ |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= }} {{TagLine|N600 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit VDSL2 Modem Router}} :[https://www.netgear.com/support/product/dgnd3800b Support page]
This device may be identical to the [[Netgear DGND3700v1]]. :It shares the same basic Foxconn board ID: U12L144T01 {{see also|Netgear|Foxconn}} *[http://openwrt.org/toh/netgear/dgnd3700 ''Netgear DGND3700/DGND3800B'' on the '''OpenWrt''' wiki] ([https://openwrt.org/_media/media/netgear/dgnd3800/dgnd3800b_pcb-top-with-serial-pins.jpg board image]) :Per the dmesg output, this device has a 128MB NAND Flash. :This appears to be in addition to the 32MB Flash listed :in the entry, just like the [[Netgear DGND3700v1]]. *[https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=36824 Netgear DGND3800B on the '''OpenWrt''' forums]
